title: 2017 Latvian Higher League
text:
The 2017 Latvian Higher League is the 26th season of top-tier <a href="association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>. <a href="FK%20Spartaks%20J%C5%ABrmala">Spartaks Jūrmala</a> are the defending champions, having won their first title in the <a href="2016%20Latvian%20Higher%20League">previous</a> season. 
Teams.
The bottom-placed team from the <a href="2016%20Latvian%20Higher%20League">2016</a> season, <a href="BFC%20Daugavpils">BFC Daugavpils</a>, were directly relegated to the <a href="2017%20Latvian%20First%20League">2017 Latvian First League</a>. They were replaced by <a href="SK%20Bab%C4%ABte">Babīte</a>, champions of the <a href="2016%20Latvian%20First%20League">2016 Latvian First League</a>.
The seventh-placed team from the 2016 season, <a href="FS%20METTA/Latvijas%20Universit%C4%81te">FS METTA/LU</a>, retained their top-flight spot for the 2017 season by defeating 2016 First League runners-up, <a href="AFA%20Olaine">AFA Olaine</a> in the <a href="2016%20Latvian%20Higher%20League%23Relegation%20play-offs">play-offs</a>.
<a href="SK%20Bab%C4%ABte">Babīte</a> was removed from the league on 22 June 2017 after the Latvian Football Federation received a notice from <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a>'s Betting Fraud Detection System for 6 separate games involving Babīte. All the results for Babīte games were invalidated and do not count for the standings.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Results.
Each team will play the other seven teams home-and-away twice, for a total of 28 games each.
Relegation play-offs.
The seventh-placed side faced the runners-up of the <a href="2017%20Latvian%20First%20League">2017 Latvian First League</a> in a two-legged play-off, with the winner being awarded a spot in the <a href="2018%20Latvian%20Higher%20League">2018 Higher League</a> competition.
